FuncDef: The reset access trigger user-table command deletes information about users whose access packets are limited on a board.
CLIs: reset access trigger user-table slot <slot-id> [ interface { <interface-type> <interface-number> | <interface-name> } ] [ mac-address <mac-address> ] [ ip-address <ip-address> ] [ prefix <prefix-address> ] [ ipv6-address <ipv6-address> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Deletes detailed information about users on a specified interface.
-

Deletes detailed information about the user with a specified MAC address.
The value is a 12-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of H-H-H. Each H is 4 digits. If an H contains fewer than 4 digits, the left-most digits are padded with zeros. For example, e0 is displayed as 00e0.

Deletes detailed information about the user with a specified IPv4 address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Deletes detailed information about the user with a specified IPv6 prefix.
The value is a 32-bit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Deletes detailed information about the user with a specified IPv6 address.
The value is a 32-bit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Deletes information about users whose access packets are limited on all boards.
-

Deletes information about users whose access packets are limited on the board in a specified slot.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the access trigger packet-limit command is run to configure a limit on the number of ARP/IP/IPv6/ND packets that can be sent to the main control board, you can run the reset access trigger user-table command to delete information about users whose access packets are limited.
Prerequisites
The access trigger packet-limit command has been run.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
